column4: nvidia-common is not the drivers package, you probably want nvidia-current
ah, thanks
pp7: if you are still available, I appear to be no further along.  xserver fails to start, can't find nvidia, modprobe can't load it.
uname -a and dkms status
Linux mike-desktop 2.6.35-31-generic #63-Ubuntu SMP Mon Nov 28 19:23:11 UTC 2011 i686 GNU/Linux and nvidia-current, 260.19.06, 2.6.35-31-generic, i686: installed
looks fine, try: sudo modprobe nvidia-current; and check /var/log/kern.log for errors involving nvidia at the end
FATAL: Error inserting nvidia_current (/lib/modules/2.6.35-31-generic/updates/dkms/nvidia-current.ko): No such device
nvidia: probe of 0000:01:00.0 failed with error -1 from kern.log
I'm really not sure, maybe nouveau loaded first? is it listed in lsmod?
I see nouveau in lsmod
is it possible it's not getting blacklisted?
yeah seems to be the case
any idea how to prevent it from loading?  I'd look it up but for some reason my web browsing ability seems to be almost non-existent right this minute
do you have an /etc/modprobe.d/nvidia-graphics-drivers.conf? it should be blacklisting nouveau lbm-nouveau nvidia-173 nvidia-96 (although this is on lucid not maverick)
checking now
you should be able to copy the file there from /lib/nvidia-current/modprobe.conf
ok, it's got the blacklist there, I'll see if it's in /lib too
the blacklist is in nvidia-current/modprobe.conf as well ><
This problem just started when I upgraded my video card to 550 Ti - wonder if that's the problem
that may be it, quick search leads me to believe that card isn't supported with your nvidia version (doesn't seem to be added until 267.59
sounds right.
looks like I should distro upgrade to 11.04 so I can get 270+ nvidia driver for 550 ti support
but thanks so much for all your efforts.
